title: Reunion
opening: Ostia's military primarily consists of soldiers in heavy defense gear, such as Armor Knights and Generals. With them, Castle Ostia's defenses have always been incredibly strong. For a long time now, the castle has been rumored to be "unconquerable."
However, that rumor was about to be proven wrong. By Roy, who, ironically, wanted to protect the castle.

intro.speaker: Leygance
intro.line: What?! The enemy has broken into the castle? What the hell was Devias doing out there?! Were those knights from Ilia so strong? ... Or was the Lycia Army larger than I expected... In any case, they have gotten into the 'unconquerable' Castle Ostia!

intro.speaker: Leygance
intro.line: We must drive them out, or Bern will look down upon us... You over there!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Leygance
intro.line: Set up the troops all over the castle! Especially around the throne room! Prepare your defenses! We must not let the Lycia Army get any further into the castle!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Understood sir!

intro.speaker: Leygance
intro.line: One more thing. I want you to discreetly kill Lilina during the battle.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: What? ... Sir, weren't we supposed to keep her alive?

intro.speaker: Leygance
intro.line: I was planning on using her as a hostage. But there are still many rebels that put faith in her. If we openly use her as a hostage, those soldiers might turn against us.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: But in that case sir, they would surely turn on us if we kill her!

intro.speaker: Leygance
intro.line: So I said to do it discreetly, didn't I?! Kill her quietly, and pretend that she was hit by a stray arrow. Then we can make the enemy responsible for it! Now go!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir...

intro.speaker: Astore
intro.line: ... General Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army, I presume.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ! Who are you? An enemy?!

intro.speaker: Astore
intro.line: No, I'm on your side. Greetings, my name is Astore. I used to work here in the service of Lord Hector.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Excuse me, but what kind of work were you doing? You certainly don't look like one of Ostia's servants...

intro.speaker: Astore
intro.line: My, my, aren't we a little rude, old man? See, I'm a spy. I go on secret missions to gather information, steal things, check on people... that kind of thing.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Hmm, I see.

intro.speaker: Astore
intro.line: If people can tell that I'm working for a noble just by looking at me, then I'm not much of a spy, am I? Anyway, for a month now, I've been running around Lycia to gather the latest news. When I heard about Lord Hector's death in Araphen, I returned here as quickly as I could. Then I see that those idiots, Leygance and Devias, have caused a rebellion! I didn't make it in time to save Lord Hector, but I don't want to be too late for Lady Lilina.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Then you'll join us? Good, let's work together to rescue her. Do you know where Lilina is?

intro.speaker: Astore
intro.line: Of course, investigating into matters like that is my job. Lady Lilina is locked into a small room in the center of the castle. And that dastard Leygance is sitting on the throne like he owns the place.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: We have to hurry then. We must defeat the rebels and rescue Lilina before Narcian arrives from Bern!

battle.speaker: Lilina
battle.line: What's all that noise? Is there a battle going on? I wonder what's happening outside...

battle.speaker: Ogier
battle.line: Sir Barth, this is a dead end!

battle.speaker: Barth
battle.line: Don't worry. This wall has cracks in it. We can break through it if we hit it a little with our weapons.

battle.speaker: Wendy
battle.line: I wonder where Lady Lilina is?

battle.speaker: Barth
battle.line: I have a pretty good idea where she is. We've known this castle for a long time. Hmm, I do wonder what's causing all the noise, though.

battle.speaker: Wendy
battle.line: The Alliance Army? Then my brother must be with them...

battle.speaker: Barth
battle.line: ... We don't know if he's still alive. You shouldn't have such high expectations.

battle.speaker: Ogier
battle.line: Sir Barth, you don't have to be so cold. He's Wendy's only brother, right?

battle.speaker: Barth
battle.line: You must never look away from reality.

battle.speaker: Wendy
battle.line: It's all right, Ogier. Sir Barth is right.

battle.speaker: Barth
battle.line: As an Armor Knight of Ostia, you must never panic, no matter what the situation. Understood, Wendy?

battle.speaker: Cath
battle.line: Yes! Just as I thought, they're at each other again. I mean, how stupid can these nobles get? I can never understand what the fun is in fighting all the time. Oh well, guess I'll swipe what I can.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: We have finally recaptured the castle, Lilina.

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: Thank you, Roy. I'm glad that my father didn't have to go through the trouble.

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: Roy, is my father still in Araphen? I heard it was a tough battle there, but does it look like it's going to take much longer?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lilina... haven't you heard anything?

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lord Hector... has passed away.

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: What...?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I'm sorry... When we arrived at Castle Araphen... It was already under Bern's control.

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: It's not your fault... Don't apologize.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lord Hector was already severely wounded when we arrived. If only we had gotten there faster, maybe I could have helped him...

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: No... it's okay. I... was prepared for this... I'm a warrior's daughter. I've been taught not to panic in times like this.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lilina.

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: So everyone should have told me... They're too considerate... I'm strong too, you know...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Lilina, you don't have to hold back in front of me.

end.speaker: Lilina
end.line: Roy... I...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It's okay... I'll be with you.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy! Bern's Dragon Knights have appeared at Castle Ostia!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What! They're here already?

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: Hehehe... Are you Roy? I must thank you for getting rid of that idiot Leygance for me. Now, you will leave Ostia to me.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Don't be ridiculous! Who would give Ostia to the likes of you..!

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: Oh? Then do you wish to fight us with that sad little group of yours? I shall annihilate you, as I did with Hector!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Damn!

end.speaker: Unknown Person
end.line: That's enough!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: General Narcian! A legion has arrived from Etruria!

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: I can see that, you fool! Why...

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I am Percival, Knight General of Etruria. Yesterday, Sorcery General Cecilia informed me that Ostia had requested Etruria's protection.

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: What...!

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: You seem discontent. We are prepared for battle. But can those Dragon Knights of yours stand a chance against all of us?

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: You...!

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: I am Cecilia, Sorcery General of Etruria! Ostia is now under our protection.

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: Argh... You... you...!!!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: General Narcian, please control your temper! General Percival is one of the strongest warriors in Etruria! And with General Cecilia here as well we'll be slaughtered!

end.speaker: Narcian
end.line: I know! We're leaving! Cecilia, is it? Watch your back from now on!

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: Are you General Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Y-Yes! I am in charge of the Alliance Army in the place of Lord Hector.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I see. Lycia is in a time of hardship. Our king also sends his words of regret for Lord Hector's death.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Thank you for your consideration. If Etruria hadn't helped us... Ostia would be under Bern's control now. Thank you very much.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I'm not the one to thank. I simply followed my king's orders. You should thank Cecilia, who went against the king to help you.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: She... disobeyed the king's orders?

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: Yes, now isn't that something? Well, I must be off. Two of the three Etrurian Generals shouldn't be leaving the country for so long. Cecilia, can you take care of the rest?

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Yes. Thank you, Percival. You can leave the rest to me.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Whew... General Percival... Now he's someone.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Nervous, were you?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: General Cecilia! It is good to see you again.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: How are you doing, Roy? You look a little tired, but you seem okay.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes, thanks to Etruria, we were able to avoid disaster.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: I'm glad we made it here in time.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I'm sorry. I put you through a lot of trouble.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: No. It's going to be beneficial for Etruria for Ostia to go under our protection.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Beneficial?

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Yes. Bern's been acting aggressively these days, as you know. We also want to do something about it, but since we haven't been directly invaded, we have no reason to go to war with them. But if Bern gets any stronger, the balance of powers would be shattered.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: So when Ostia requested protection, you saw it as a good reason to declare war on Bern?

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Right. We just did what would be best for us. You don't need to feel that you're in our debt.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: So you shouldn't thank us.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Understood. I won't. Well anyway, come in and meet the rest of our army.

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: ... He's gotten so bold in the short time that I haven't seen him. Well, he is a boy, after all.

battle-talk.speaker: Wendy
battle-talk.line: Bors! You're all right!

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: Why, is it Wendy? I'm glad to see you're okay too. ...!? What the... What are you wearing? Did you apply to become an Ostian Armor Knight or something?

battle-talk.speaker: Wendy
battle-talk.line: Ah... Actually, I did. I was knighted just yesterday.

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: What are you doing... I thought I told you to leave the fighting to us and live your life as you wished! You didn't need to become an Armor Knight...

battle-talk.speaker: Wendy
battle-talk.line: Yes, well, I thought about it, and what I truly want is to become a knight.

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: But...

battle-talk.speaker: Wendy
battle-talk.line: I don't want to just wait for you to return from battle. I want to become a knight as great as you.

battle-talk.speaker: Wendy
battle-talk.line: ... Bors?

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: Well, you were always stubborn, weren't you, Wendy?

battle-talk.speaker: Wendy
battle-talk.line: Bors...

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: You should live your life as you wish. If Mother and Father were alive, they would say that as well. But the way of the knight is no easy feat!

battle-talk.speaker: Wendy
battle-talk.line: Yes, I'm prepared! I shall never give up!

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: Lilina!

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: ... Roy? Is it really you?

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: Yes!

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: You came! Thank you.

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: Thank goodness you're all right. Here, take this spell book. Use it to defend yourself for the time being.

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: Thanks.

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: Lady Lilina! You are safe!

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: Bors, I am sorry that I worried you.

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: Not at all, my Lady! You were alive... That in itself...

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Bors. And you kept your promise that you would protect Roy for me. I knew I was doing the right thing when I asked you.

battle-talk.speaker: Bors
battle-talk.line: Thank you, my Lady!

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: Barth!

battle-talk.speaker: Barth
battle-talk.line: Lady Lilina! I am happy to see you are safe.

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: Barth, you were right. Leygance was planning a rebellion.

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: I'm sorry... If I had believed you in the first place, this wouldn't have happened...

battle-talk.speaker: Barth
battle-talk.line: No... Lady Lilina, you do not have anything to apologize about. The one to be prosecuted is Leygance, who insulted your kind and trusting heart toward him. It is your kindness that we respect the most, my Lady.

battle-talk.speaker: Lilina
battle-talk.line: Barth...

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: It's you!

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: Crap... Er, what a coincidence! Hahaha...

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: ... If you're in the battlefield just to steal, you shouldn't be. It's not right.

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: Don't worry. I only take from the rich who have plenty of money. No one's going to starve or anything.

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: That's not the point.

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: Oh really? Then let me ask you this. You nobles take food and money from the people living in what you call your territory. Who said that was your land, anyway? And you say you're collecting taxes, but what you're doing is the same. Looting!

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: What?! But we protect the people in return...

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: But you're not! You're killing your own people, causing a war like this!

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: Well... Bern started to invade, so we had to fight to defend our people...

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: So you can just do anything you want, as long as you say you're protecting us? You can burn down villages and ruin our crops?

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: Burned? We never...! Wait a minute, was your... ?

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: ... My village was burned to the ground by our marquess. He said that he had no choice because he needed to prepare for Bern's attacks.

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: Well... that's...

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: We always had just enough to eat and survive, and then we just lost everything... Our homes... our crops... And then you say not to take from other people? Ha! You shouldn't be talking! You dastards from the nobility take from us so you can live in luxury while we suffer!

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: I... don't know what to say.

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: Sigh. We're getting all gloomy now. I really don't like talking about 'I'm worse off so you should pity me' arguments. But you're the one who started it.

battle-talk.speaker: Cath
battle-talk.line: Ah, to heck with this. It's not fun stealing after a talk like that. Well, I guess I better bail out then. See ya!

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: You vermin of the Alliance Army... Come. I shall cut down all of you!

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: Why? You are only... to be trampled upon by Bern... How can you fight so hard...?

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: Bors! So you were still alive.

boss.speaker: Bors
boss.line: Of course. Taking Ostia while we weren't around...

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: Is that a problem? Then try and take it back with your own strength and skill

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: Lady Lilina? Damn, you were supposed to be dead by now...

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: Times are changing, my Lady. I'm just making sure I don't get left behind. I'm not like Lord Hector, who was too foolish to realize the change.

boss.speaker: Lilina
boss.line: Quiet! You will not insult my father any further!

boss.speaker: Wendy
boss.line: General Leygance! You shall rest here!

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: Ah, Bors' sister, is it? It's nice to be brave and all, but can you really defeat me?

boss.speaker: Barth
boss.line: Leygance, you fool! Are you not ashamed that you betrayed Lord Hector?!

boss.speaker: Leygance
boss.line: Barth... Shut up. Lord Hector stupidly caused his death. I do not plan on falling with him.
